intro: Erythronium tuolumnense, commonly known as the Tuolumna trillium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, nodding flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often matted together at the base. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Erythronium tuolumnense thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats.
